Docs.param: The zero-based index at which an item should be inserted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `Count` already equals the capacity, the capacity of the list is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If `index` is equal to `Count`, `value` is added to the end of `XmlSchemaObjectCollection`.
The elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Remove (System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject item);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject item) cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>. That is, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
This method determines equality by calling <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A>.
The elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot.
